H0.text: The genetic code is the relationship between a nucleotide codon and its corresponding amino acid.

H1.text: RNA is the relationship between a nucleotide codon and its corresponding amino acid.

H2.text: DNA is the relationship between a nucleotide codon and its corresponding amino acid.

H3.text: Protein is the relationship between a nucleotide codon and its corresponding amino acid.

A4.text: The codons encoding one amino acid may differ in any of their three positions.

A5.text: Genetic code is a set of rules used by living cells to translate information encoded within genetic material (DNA or RNA sequences of nucleotide triplets or codons) into proteins.
